title: Glacier National Park: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials Bring Glacier National Park into your classroom! Glacier’s Teacher Guide provides lessons for both field trip-bound students and students learning about our ecosystem in the classroom. There are pages for all grade levels. Plus links to additional curriculum resources. All Curriculum Materials       See Glacier's Teacher Guide Learn More     Traveling Trunks Do your students want to touch a bear skull, listen to songbirds sing, or wear a real park ranger uniform? Traveling trunks focusing on topics from fire ecology to grizzly bears are available for local check out.  Find out more about borrowing Glacier’s traveling trunks today! All Traveling Trunks       Borrow Glacier's Traveling Trunks Learn More     Field Trips Bring your students to Glacier!  Plan a Ranger-led field trip or get information about self-guided programs and service learning opportunities in Glacier. Have your students visit a beaver lodge, hike a trail through the re-growth of a burned forest, or for older students, get up to a cirque lake. In winter, students can strap on snowshoes and feel what it's like to be a camouflaged snowshoe hare! All Field Trips       Plan your ranger-guided field trip Learn More     Institutes & Field Schools The Glacier Institute, a private nonprofit, provides hands-on, field-based educational adventures in the wilds of Glacier National Park and the Flathead National Forest, located within the Crown of the Continent ecosystem! There are courses and opportunities for all ages. All Institutes & Field Schools       Check out Big Creek Discovery School Learn More
